title: Such authentic dishes from Bali, Indonesia, Vietnam & more
text: For our first trip to Barcelona after many months, we wanted lunch in El Ravel to celebrate & were attracted by the great reviews. We sat outside in the sunshine and loved our choice of menu. There is not a huge choice but each one was so tasty and yes, we asked for the piquant option which is still quite mild for those not too keen on chilli. We definitely will be back!

title: Fantastic value, delicious menu and friendly atmosphere
text: Lloret de Mar twon was very quiet early in the season but we soon found where everyone was, Al Freskita! All the dishes were served fresh and very quickly with lovely friendly staff to make the atmosphere seem more holiday like atmosphere. I am sure you will need to book when the tourist season begins. Recommended for home cooked food.

title: Great lunch stop for delicious grilled meat
text: Choose from a great choice of dishes here cooked well on the grill, including lots of speciality sausages. There's lots of outside space, although when we visited it was on the chilly side and we huddled around the wood burning stove. I am sure it will be excellent in the Summer. Only thing letting the place down was a rather sullen waitress, but hey, the food was so good we went back again!

title: Perfect setting, perfect menu, perfect staff!
text: It was a first visit for my daughter's birthday and we were so lucky with the weather so could enjoy the great views from the terrace outside in April. There is covered space and beautiful internal rooms if you prefer. The menu was luxurious as we pushed the boat out with oysters and lobster! but each course was a delight including the mise en bouches that began the meal. Thoroughly recommend and just sorry I did not find it sooner!

title: What a gem, worth a special trip to Bisbal.
text: We were exploring old Bisbal after a long lockdown restriction and I found this friendly little restaurant from its excellent reviews. We were very impressed with the menu and although there is no outside space, the high ceilings and well spaced tables meant we felt very safe inside. We will return!

title: Fine dining with a South American twist on the Costa Brava
text: I have been following this restaurant since it opened, living close to Palamos, but never having the time to visit. The sad reduction in tourist visitors this summer meant that there was a chance for locals to enjoy this wonderful experience on a Sunday in August! Thoroughly enjoyed the combination of two cultures and the maitre d was welcoming and informative. Just sorry not to thank the chef personally at the end of our meal but the restaurant was so busy late afternoon. Hope to return soon for the taster menu.

title: Excellent weekend menu with wonderful staff & great outdoor seating
text: We were excited to get out & enjoy a meal after the long lockdown. We loved our visit to Arrels after a few trips when eating outside felt scarey & uncontrolled. This week our shoulders relaxed and we remembered how much fun it is to enjoy good food in a great environment! The dishes were wonderful, with melt in the mouth meat dishes, we sat under the awnings outside with lots of distance between tables do felt very safe and the staff in masks were attentive and friendly. Thoroughly recommend for your first trip out after lockdown!

title: Impressive ancient theatre with great acoustics
text: It was appalling weather when we visited but still worth the walk around to see this great building. We also took a look in the museum which had a few interesting steles relating to the cure of illnesses, but dare I say it, needs a bit of a revamp for a modern audience or young family.

title: Highly decorated old church with interesting votive offerings
text: This is a great little place to visit on a tour of the old town. I wish there was more information there to appreciate it.

title: Impossible not to feel a huge sense of history in this ancient palace
text: We visited in atrocious weather but in a way that made it more evocative of the Trojan story in the moody light. The musuem is a good source of information and I enjoyed a walk around the site to see the mountain wild flowers.

title: Staggering piece of engineering to see even on an appalling day!
text: It was pouring with rain on our day trip to the Peloponnese, but happy to stop off and walk over the canal. The water was an intense silvery blue even on a wet day.

title: Authentic greek food made from ingredients straight from the market
text: We were recommended this little restaurant on a food tour of the market and our hostess was friendly and helpful as we tasted lots of specialities including the famous trotter and tripe soup which is supposed to counter any long night on the town. Thoroughly recommend but you must be adventurous!

title: One of the most friendly food markets I have visited, with a wonderful fish section
text: I have travelled to food markets all over the world and feel the frustration of some of the stall holders when visitors like myself are not interested in buying, only asking questions. Here everyone was smiling and helpful and let me take lots of photos. I especially liked Epirus Tavern within it where we tasted the famous tripe and trotter soup. Delicious!

title: So much to see and learn from a history not well known in Northern Europe
text: I was a little overwhelmed here by the volume of information available. However, I particularly enjoyed the textile exhibitions and the Macedonian room layouts which brought the history more alive. Certainly left me wanting ro read up more on Greek history and geography.

title: A beautiful gallery space but the erotic nude exhibition was not to my taste
text: I have never complained about an exhibition before, but I did when visiting the Frissiras Museum. I love modern art and certainly am not averse to the adult female nude but there were several exhibits in the Love is a Dog from Hell exhibition that I believe should have been censored where young teenage girls were presented as sexual objects. I would urge the curating team to choose more carefully and fill this beautiful space with inspiring art.

title: A very lively restaurant, loved by locals, with live music
text: Taken here by a local night life tour and it certainly is a busy, noisy place. Not somewhere to go if you would like a conversation! It is notably a favourite of locals who were drinking and dancing! The food was very good, but as service was so rushed, presentation and flavour were not quite as great as other restaurants in the Plaka area.

title: The fact that so many locals are obviously regulars here says it all!
text: We followed the good reviews to find this tavern and were pleased we did as it tasted like very genuine, Greek family food. The presentation was not special and the waitress seemed a little harassed, as there were so many people passing through, but we thoroughly enjoyed our lunch.

title: Wonderful food in a memorable setting
text: You can not beat a restaurant table looking down over the city, under the shadow of the Acropolis. This is one of the less well tread corners of this busy area so great for a shady lunch or romantic meal in the evening. Food was traditional and cooked to perfection.

title: Great cocktails, friendly service & love the decor
text: We stopped off for a long, lazy cocktail and to rest tired feet after exploring the area. So good we had two!

title: Great stopover after a visit to the Basil & Elise Goulandris Foundation
text: After enjoying a trip around the Goulandris Modern Art Foundation, it was great to sit and relax outside and absorb all the sites we had just seen. Great cocktails and friendly service.

title: Loved the combination of well known artists and new Greek names in one, beautiful museum
text: This beautiful building is in an elegant area of Athens and once inside I was amazed at the variety and quality of the exhibits. It had only been open a month when we visited, but the guides and layout were already spectacular. I wish it continued success in these difficult days.

title: Beautiful view with temple nearby
text: This garden is beautifully kept by numerous gardeners and there is a lovely view of the valley. I particularly enjoyed seeing the temple just next to it which was having a blessing ceremony on the day of our visit.

title: Once in a lifetime experienc to see big cats in the wild
text: My friends and I stayed 3 days in the area and went on a total of 5 safaris, two of them on the water and 3 by jeep. It should be stressed to those visiting just once, that animals are in the wild, not tagged in anyway, so it is very much down to luck what and how many animals and birds you see. The guides talk to each other by radio when there is an important sighting, but then there is a big jumble of jeeps and buses rush to the area so visibility is reduced. The length of time the enthusiastic amateur photographers require to take the perfect shot is also frustrating. Simply observing these beautiful creatures in their natural environment is not enough for many but I found it a privelege to simply view tigers, leopard, deer,monkeys and many birds in the wild.

title: Pleasant walk to a waterfall undercut with coffee bushes
text: The waterfall is of course as spectacular as the rain that precedes your visit so after little rain the falls were a little underwhelming. However, the walk down to the falls is very beautiful and worth the trip.

title: A fun place to meet local people but needing a revamp
text: This little island park is popular for families but especially young people with all types of sweet and drinks stalls at the entrance where they hang out. The exhibits, with the exception of the spotted deer all looked, a little over worn and sad. The boats were extremely popular but judging by the people getting off, be prepared to get soaked!

title: Comfortable, modern hotel with beautiful grounds
text: Such a beautiful place to wake up in with so much birdsong floating in from the well kept grounds. The food and staff in the restaurant were excellent and I loved the 10 minute walk to the little island park of Nisargadhama. The greeting talk from the lady manager was dictatorial rather than friendly but it did not spoil our stay!

title: Very comfotable stay with excellent food.
text: It was only a short stay with friends but very comfortable and the breakfast was excellent. The staff were very helpful when I wanted help visiting sites, only sorry that it was not warm enough for the pool.

title: The most peaceful of places & a great centre for exploring Nagarhole Park
text: I traveled a single person & I was so pleased that I was given such a beautiful room, having stayed in some dreadful spots when not in a couple! The evening meals were delicious and followed drinks by the fire on the shore. I also loved the opportunity to look around their fruit and vegetable garden so thanks to our guide. Loved the place.

title: Absolutely stunning murals & architecture in a Tibetan refugee community
text: This is a very busy place with residents celbrating prayer and running their community whilst welcoming visitors to the stunning Golden Temple and associated buildings. Beautiful.

title: A museum and fort with so much history, but little to see or information available
text: I would have loved to know more about the history of Tipu Sultan in the area and in the museum there were some ancient carvings which deserved pride of place, but little information available. The old palace/fort is closed to visitors as it is used for government buildings. A lots opportunity for Coorg tourism.

title: Wonderful to be allowed in such a popular place for worshippers
text: It was a very busy festival day in January when my friends and I visited so there were street sellers everywhere, including offerings of coconut and flowers. Several of us queued to go in and were blessed by the monks for our offering of flowers.

title: Imagine the riches of the maharajah of Mysore!
text: Several rooms in the palace are breathtaking, my favourite being the Public Durbar Hall with its magnificent columns. I particularly loved the tiger bronzes of W Rober Colton.

title: Beautiful summer palace with fantastic murals
text: This palace really peaked my interest in the story of Tipu Sultan. The murals are wonderful and the colours amazing for their age.

title: Inforamtive guide to tea growing & essentail oils and great views
text: Our excellent guide was very knowledgable about the whole process of preparing different types of tea & chai. All the processes were underway when we visited in January. At the end of the trip you can try each kind and take a look at essential oil and chocolate production. I came away with a deep appreciation of the work involved in our daily cuppa!

title: A little throwback in time to travel through the valley
text: Enjoyed the experience of riding from Mettupalayam back to Ooty, but wasted a lot of time in the day queueing BEFORE the ticket office opened one hour before the journey to ensure a place, having missed all the tickets earlier in the day for the opposite direction. Please note for enthusiasts, this is not the steam section of the journey. Being able to buy advanced tickets would have given us more time to enjoy the surrounding area.

title: Such a lovely way to spend a couple of hours in the company of local families
text: These gardens really took me back in time to the municipal gardens of England in the 50s. The Fern house and Annuals Greenhouse were really beautiful and not suprisingly there is a queue of people taking selfies in the most colourful areas. There are a couple of areas being renovated - the Japanese Garden and the Waterfall area, but there was lots to enjoy elsewhere.

title: One of the funkiest places to eat with a colonial vibe
text: Friends and I stayed in the hotel for 3 nights and ate in the restaurant every night. I enjoyed the Indian dishes but one of the standout treats was beautifully cooked fish and chips. My friends appreciated the other British and Italian dishes on the menu. Service was eratic to say the least, probably because the staff did not always understand English but also because the food arrived in any order and in any combination. It became a standing joke to see who would finish main course before others had their starters. Nevertheless, we enjoyed the cosy atmosphere of the fire each evening whilst we dined.

title: One of the quirkiest hotels I have ever stayed
text: I have given the hotel an average score not because everything was generally average but because it is a mixture of highs and lows. As a single person I was placed in a windowless room which was obviously once the estate office. The bed was comfortable but for a 3 day stay I found it very oppressive, cold and unwelcoming, with no wifi. I sat by the fire in the lounge for most of my stay. Many of the staff are extremely friendly, the night watchman was a lovely man and took me on a walk to the nearby tea plantation, but others can barely speak English and it is a bit of a lottery if you get what you asked for at the time you asked for it! The double rooms looked very comfortable and the food was great but it became a standing joke to find who would get their main course before there starters and in what order around the table. I suspect some of the staff are probably from the nearby catering college and perhaps are not paid or trained!

title: Friendly efficient staff and smart rooms
text: A group of friends and I stayed only one night but were impressed by the staff at reception and at the bar. The rooms are very comfortable and we enjoyed microbrewery nearby! We had an early start but breakfast was kindly prepared for us to takeaway Oh and the fish were amazing!.

title: Delightful final few days in Mysuru
text: I was given a beautiful room overlooking Chamundi hill. Breakfast buffet was absolutely delicious and the dining staff excelled. The pool area is a great place to relax and drink with friends at the end of a busy day.

title: A great pleasure to visit this popular eating spot and talk to regulars
text: If not for the rave reviews I would not have given this restaurant a second look! You must walk in, sit down with others at the table and staff quickly come with banana leaves as your plate and load you up with food of your choice. Loved it.

title: Miserable staff but tasty, good value food
text: This was a roadside cafe with staff who were appeared not too happy to serve a minibus load of passengers, but nevertheless the food was served quickly and was excellent value.

title: So many beautiful doorways to admire with elegant staff to give information
text: I loved slowly wandering around the rooms and alleyways of this palace complex but I found the cost of entering the palace itself a little steep. Happy to just view the architecture surrounding it.

title: An onslaught of all the senses & wonderful experience
text: You have the feeling that this part of the city looks no different to the life of hundreds of years ago. The choice is fantastic and the spices so fresh to make the most of it and purchase some special additions to your spice cupboard.
placeLocation: National Capital Territory of Delhi, India

title: Beautiful presentation and delicious food but service a little off
text: I came with a group of friends to this restaurant for a light lunch. Understandably the staff are very proud of their choice of dishes but we had the distinct impression that becuase we wanted just a few select dishes (we would eat a big meal later in the evening) we got the impression the staff backed off from giving the care that other clients received. We waited a long time for our bill when we were on a tight schedule. Fantastic food, but please treat all clients equally!

title: Beautiful building but the square quite p
text: After climbing the steps to this mosque, shoes must be removed & ladies must enter separately & wear a special covering. Inside you are free to wander around the worshippers square but can not enter the prayer hall. Beautiful from the outside but pales against the many marble buildings I visited later on my trip.

title: Don't rush this site, so much to see
text: The style of architecture is so distinctive here at this walled Mughal city. Take your time and enjoy all the arches, columns and decorations to the walls, both interior and exterior. I particularly like the old kitchen decorated with a stream of earrings or tassles!

title: Spend a peaceful couple of hours in the company of great artists
text: I was lucky enough to visit the NGMA when there was an exhibition of photographs by Prabuddha Dasgupta. The building and grounds are beautiful and there is a little cafe so make some time on your visit to Bangalore for this little haven.

title: Gorgeous building and add it to a walk down the bazaar of Tripolia
text: This is a very busy area of Jaipur, but worth taking the time to find a spot without being run over to admire it. Watch yourselves if you try to have a coffee from the buildings opposite, you will find you pay a lot for the view. I enjoyed a walk around this whole area of the city.

title: The best hotel we stayed in India
text: The rooms are so beautifully decorated, the restaurant is excellent and the staff are all so helpful and friendly. I unfortunately was ill when I arrived here and they kindly arranged for me to move to a quiet room where they kept an eye on me to make sure all was well. I would recommend to anyone visiting Jaipur

title: Grand proportions & open gardens make this a relaxing oasis
text: This garden tomb precedes the Taj Mahal and although is not as lush with decoration, a visit is important as an early example of this type of Murghal architecture. I found it very peaceful place to walk around.

title: Wonderful place to start our journey in India
text: There was a lovely welcome waiting for us with drinks and flowers and the rooms were very comfortable. Staff were always smiling and ready to help if you want transport into town. Early check out was no problem.

title: So much to see here before you visit the Taj
text: Sadly the Agra Fort and its palaces does not have huge write ups in guide books as everyone rushes to the Taj Mahal, but on the opposite bank of the river Yamuna, there is so much to see. Take your first view of the Taj from the palace where its builder Shah Jahan was imprisoned by his son so that he could look to his wife's tomb each day! There are palaces, barracks and lots of monkeys.

title: this marble perfection brought tears to my eyes
text: This is a stunning building and don't believe all you read that you must be there for sunrise to see a pink hue on the building! I went on a very cold, wintry day and silver light made the visit quite etheral. Of course the cold also meant there were far less visitors than normal so we were able to enjoy all the parts of the site in comforatable splendour. Just beautiful.

title: Friendly, helpful staff and a food choice of dishes
text: We were a little nervous as we descended into a celler area with an abanadoned restaurant above, but once inside we were given a warm welcome and the place was attractive. The staff were friendly and efficient, most importantly the food tasted very fresh and fragrant. The different naan breads were excellent.

title: A comfortable restaurant with great food
text: On the day we visited for an excellent lunch there seemed to be an excessive number of staff, with several managers dictating from the side lines. It was a little overwhelming, but none the less a good choice of excellent dishes served quickly which was appreciated as we were on a tour.

title: Great seafood, easy to park midweek and right by the sea
text: After picking someone up at the airport, I called in at Port Olympic for a little R&R by the seaside before making my way home. A great mojito whilst waiting for the table on a busy holiday Monday. My calamari was excellent hence the rating, but the children's pasta was very disappointing, sweet and gluey. I told the waiter, kids like good food too! Can't beat the location.

title: peaceful way to spend an afternoon exploring independent shops, eateries and beautiful buildings
text: I can't believe it has taken me 20 years to get to the Gracia district of Barcelona! It has the peaceful atmosphere of a small town with lots of interesting independent shops, bars and restaurants to explore. A slow walk down Carrer de Verdi is a must, Casa Vicens is amazing and look to the roof tops for many more beautiful Modernist buildings.

title: What a joy to find authentic Vietnamese style food in Gracia
text: We loved the weekend lunch menu at this Asian restaurant which was great value at 13.50€. After a recent trip to Vietnam it was wonderful to find tasty authentic spring rolls and pho with fresh herbs zinging through. My daughter loved the pork dumplings and satay chicken noodles. The staff were efficient and friendly and service very fast which was great as we had a guided tour at Casa Vicens nearby booked at 2.30pm. The restaurant is tiny and I quite understand them being unable to cater for buggies and high chairs as there simply would not be good access to serve customers or exit in an emergency.

title: Prefer the aerobus connection to the airport from Sants station rather than train
text: There is a short ten minute walk from Sants train station to Placa Espagna bus stop, so not ideal if your cases are heavy, but I love the little cafe by the bus stop, a walk in the sunshine and then being taken directly to T1 or T2 depending on the bus you take. Very frequest and reliable.
place: Aerobus Barcelona City Center to Airport Shuttle
